input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to make raspberry muffins?
input_text.Response A:
Position the oven rack in the middle.
Preheat the oven.
Line a muffin pan with paper liners.
Stir the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together.
Beat the butter and sugar.
Mix in the eggs, sour cream, and vanilla.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture.
Fold in the raspberries.
Mix some sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg for the topping.
Spoon the batter into the muffin pan and add the topping.
Bake the muffins for 18 to 20 minutes.
input_text.Response B: Sure, I can help you with that!  You will need the following ingredients:  1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup melted butter, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  You will also need a 9-cup baking pan.  First, preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.  Then, in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.  Then, in a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla extract.  Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.  Pour the batter into the 9-cup baking pan and spread it into an even layer.  Bake the muffins for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.  Let the muffins cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.  Once the muffins are completely cooled, you can store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.  Enjoy!
